CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice with call for competition
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C21

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: The Minister for the Cabinet Office acting through Crown Commercial Service (CCS)

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: The Minister for the Cabinet Office acting through Crown Commercial Service (CCS)
ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.ADDRESS: 9th Floor, The Capital, Old Hall Street

ADDRESS_PARTICIPATION.ADDRESS: 9th Floor, The Capital, Old Hall Street

TITLE.P: General Legal Advice Services for Central Government.

SHORT_DESCR.P: CCS wishes to establish a Panel of full service commercial law firms to provide services to ‘Permitted Users’ (in section VI.3) to support a range of significant projects, disputes and initiatives, potentially within specialist sectors (eg energy). Bidders must be able to demonstrate expertise and capacity to provide as a minimum Mandatory Specialisms:
Provision of end to end advice/support on public procurement matters inc. process structure, doc. drafting, criteria and negotiation.
Drafting, negotiating and advising on contracts. Support relationships between Permitted Users and 3rd parties — advice on rights, obligations, breaches, changes.

This procurement relates to legal services within the meaning of Schedule 3 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (PCR 2015). Given that this procurement process relates to ‘social and other specific services’ only, it is subject to limited regulation and accordingly will be conducted in accordance with regulations 74 to 76 of the PCR 2015. Any references to fully regulated processes or requirements are for ease of reference only and should not be taken as recognition nor acceptance that the same apply in this instance.
The anticipated start date of the Panel is 30.11.2016.
The anticipated maximum number of providers to be appointed to the Panel is approximately eighteen (18).

INFO_ADD.P: The total duration in II.2.7 is defined as 48 months. That total duration may be split into smaller time periods, for example 24 + 12 +12 months. The estimated value in sections II.1.5 and II.2.6 is the projected maximum spend over the life of the Panel. The actual spend may be less and no commitment is given as to the actual volume of spend, if any, under the Panel.

RULES_CRITERIA.P: Bidders must be full service commercial law firms, authorised and regulated by the Solicitors Regulation Authority, possess suitable professional indemnity insurance cover and are able to provide the Mandatory Specialisms and Mandatory Services.

This notice is a call for competition and there will be no further notices published in OJEU relating to this opportunity. Interested providers who meet all of the conditions for participation detailed herein must express an interest via email to rm3786b2@crowncommercial.gov.uk by no later than 17:00 hrs on 29.4.2016. The expression of interest must contain all of the following information:- 1. Name of potential provider; 2. Principal contact name; 3. Principal contact telephone number; 4. Principal contact e-mail address.

For the avoidance of doubt only those providers who express an interest in accordance with these instructions and who demonstrate compliance with all of the conditions for participation will be invited to tender.

REFERENCE_TO_LAW.P: All bidders must be authorised and regulated by the Solicitors Regulation Authority. All individual solicitors providing services must hold current and valid practising certificates issued by the Solicitors Regulation Authority.

INFO_ADD.P: CCS will host a small number of bidder engagement events. The dates/locations of the events are not yet confirmed, but are anticipated to be before the expression of interest deadline. Bidders wishing to attend should express an interest asap and no later than 15.03. 2016, otherwise they may not receive event details, which will be sent direct to registered bidders only. Any bidders not attending an event will be given access to any written materials shared at the events.

Permitted Users able to award contracts via the Panel are: all UK Ministerial and non-Ministerial Departments, their Executive Agencies and NDPBs, inc. successor bodies. A list of entities can be found at https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations, which may be redacted. A list of Permitted Users is also available via request from rm3786b2@crowncommercial.gov.uk
CCS is also establishing a panel for Finance, and Highly Complex Transaction Legal Advice for CG Permitted Users, please refer to PIN 3787.
